title: Grandview woman charged after toddler injured by gun
content:
KANSAS CITY, Mo. —
Prosecutors have charged a 43-year-old Grandview woman in connection with Monday night’s shooting of her 4-year-old granddaughter.
Taprill R. Barnett is charged with first-degree felony child endangerment.
According to court records, Barnett’s daughter brought the girl to her house for a visit. Barnett told police she was cleaning the gun but slid it under the couch when the victim and another child came into the room.
Barnett said she left the room, heard a pop and returned to find the girl with a gunshot wound to her leg.
“We are fortunate today that another child was not killed due to the irresponsibility of an adult. As gun owners, we have the simple responsibility to ensure that these deadly weapons are safely stored. This isn’t hard, but it is absolutely life and death,” Jackson County Prosecutor Jean Peters Baker said.
Prosecutors asked for Barnett’s bail to be set at $30,000 and asked that she not be allowed to have unsupervised contact with children.
